dialogue.text: You're right that you can't change the past. But you can relate to it differently. Thinking through your errors isn't just mental flagellationâ€”it's identity repair.

psychological_notes: The architect reframes Evan's rumination about mistakes as constructive 'identity repair' rather than pointless self-punishment. This therapeutic insight shows how reviewing errors serves psychological function - maintaining narrative coherence and self-concept continuity even when actions contradict self-image.
philosophical_underpinning: Identity as ongoing narrative construction requiring maintenance
therapeutic_direction: Transforming rumination into conscious healing work
